info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 2:39PM CDT until August 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Dodge City KS
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kansas...
Crooked Creek Near Englewood affecting Meade County.
For the Crooked Creek...including Englewood...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Crooked Creek near Englewood.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Prepare for minor overflows along portions of crooked creek in southern meade county as the creek moves out onto the floodplain.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest around 6.3 feet this evening. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY MORNING
